Taking refuge in the unsurpassed enlightenment, as well as the Dharma and the assembly of sages
The great vidyÄ-mantra heart, AparÄjitÄ herself has spoken
The TathÄgata, the Worthy of Offerings, the Perfectly Enlightened One, has also spoken this vidyÄ.
For the benefit of all sentient beings.
Accomplishing all auspicious activities.
Eliminating grave offenses, and not dying prematurely.
Extending one's lifespan and being free from various illnesses.
If there are good men, good women, boys, and girls.
Who respectfully revere this sÅ«tra.
Any humans or non-humans who harbor evil intentions.ğŸ”½RÄká¹£asas, uá¹£atras, hungry ghosts.
Sekas, apasmÄras, yaksas, and bhÅ«tas.
All the evil ones create deviant dharmas.
They curse sentient beings, causing them to be born in various realms.
They experience hunger, sickness, and all kinds of bad illnesses.
Boils, sores, tumors, scabies, leprosy, warts, and moles.
Such sufferings cannot harm them.
If there are past misfortunes and karmic offenses,
They harm each other, fight, quarrel,
And are imprisoned by royal law, or suffer from water, fire, and thief difficulties.
When such difficulties and afflictions occur,
If one recollects and recites this mantra, they will definitely be dispelled.
Free from disasters, one will enjoy auspicious peace and happiness.
Furthermore, if there are people
Who write this mantra on birch bark, silk, or paper,
Or write and make offerings elsewhere,ğŸ”½Whether wearing it on the head, neck,
Arms, hands, or carrying it inside the clothes,
Or making it into a garland to wear in the topknot,
If one upholds it in this way, one will forever be free from disasters and always enjoy peace and happiness.
If one always reads and recites it with a pure mind and body at dawn,
If one abandons the body and life, one will attain the wisdom of past lives in seven lives.
One's physical appearance will be upright and dignified, and one will always attain happiness.
One will be fully endowed with precepts and conduct.
One's mouth will always emit the fragrance of utpala flowers.
One's words will be sincere and true, and one will be loved and respected by many people.
One will also be reborn in the Heaven of the Thirty-three.
If one contemplates this mantra according to the Dharma, one will surely attain accomplishment.
